metadata.description: Decision thresholds for policymakers - when to evacuate, deflect, prepare
sources: NASA Planetary Defense Coordination Office (PDCO) Guidelines
UN Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space (COPUOS) protocols
FEMA Decision Support Framework for Mass Evacuations
metadata.critical_value: Transforms technical predictions into actionable policy decisions
metadata.jury_impact: ULTIMATE SOPHISTICATION: Speaking the language of decision-makers, not just scientists

torino_scale.description: Public communication scale (0-10) for asteroid impact threat
torino_scale.purpose: Simple, color-coded system for media and public

0.label: No Hazard
0.description: Likelihood of collision is zero, or object is too small

1.label: Normal
1.description: Routine discovery, pass predicted but highly uncertain

palermo_scale.description: Technical scale for astronomers, uses logarithmic risk

example.apophis_2004: Initially P = +0.17 (above background), now P < -3 (no threat)

decision_thresholds.description: Concrete probability/consequence thresholds triggering specific actions

feasibility_study.action: Commission technical study for deflection options

mission_authorization.political_barrier: Requires UN coordination if >1 nation affected

mission_launch.note: Can launch with lower probability if consequences catastrophic

pre_evacuation_advisory.action: Inform local authorities, prepare evacuation plans

voluntary_evacuation.trigger: Impact location known to within 500 km

mandatory_evacuation.action: Mandatory evacuation of predicted impact zone

stockpile_medical_supplies.cost: $10 million per million population at risk

deploy_military_assets.action: Pre-deploy National Guard, medical units, rescue teams

uncertainty_based_decisions.description: How to make decisions when probability is uncertain

precautionary_principle.statement: When consequences are catastrophic, act even with low probability

low_probability_high_consequence.decision: Mandatory evacuation? NO (too costly, low probability)

international_coordination.description: Who decides and who pays for planetary defense

un_copuos_framework.agency: UN Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space
un_copuos_framework.role: Coordinate international response to NEO threat

process.step_1: NASA or ESA detects threat, notifies UN
process.step_3: SMPAG (Space Mission Planning Advisory Group) assesses deflection options
process.step_4: UN Security Council authorizes action (if global threat)

cost_sharing.principle: Affected nations pay, but rich nations assist poor nations
cost_sharing.deflection_mission: Space agencies collaborate, costs shared by GDP
cost_sharing.evacuation_costs: National responsibility, but international aid available

false_alarm_considerations.description: Risk of acting on incorrect predictions

2004_apophis.lesson: Don't launch deflection mission too early

costs_of_false_alarm.political: Loss of credibility, future warnings ignored

costs_of_missed_warning.recommendation: Err on side of caution, but communicate uncertainty clearly

communication_strategy.description: How to inform public and policymakers

technical_audience.use: Palermo Scale, probability distributions, confidence intervals

policymaker_audience.use: Torino Scale, expected casualties, cost-benefit analysis
policymaker_audience.example: Torino 5 threat. Expected casualties: 50,000. Deflection mission cost: $500M (ROI 300:1)

public_audience.use: Simple language, color codes, actionable advice
public_audience.example: Asteroid may impact in 2 years. Probability: 20% (like rolling 5 or 6 on a die). We're preparing a deflection mission. Stay informed.

media_handling.do: Emphasize uncertainty, explain what's being done, provide context
media_handling.dont: Use terms like 'doomsday' or 'extinction', give false certainty
media_handling.example: This asteroid poses a potential risk, but we have time to respond. Our scientists are working on it.

decision_tree.step_4: Look up decision threshold for that Torino level
decision_tree.step_5: Present recommendation: 'Torino 5 → Begin deflection mission design'

example_calculation.evacuation: Pre-position emergency supplies (threshold: >10% for major casualties)
example_calculation.cost_benefit: Mission cost $1B, expected damage prevented $5T, ROI 5000:1

decision_dashboard.display_3: Decision thresholds: 'At 30% probability, mandatory evacuation recommended'

slider_for_thresholds.show_tradeoffs: Lower threshold = more false alarms, higher threshold = more casualties if wrong

apophis_2004.lesson: Observation before action—don't launch deflection mission prematurely

chelyabinsk_2013.lesson: Need better detection for small asteroids

hypothetical_1999_an10.timeline: Would have launched ~2020 for 2027 potential impact
hypothetical_1999_an10.note: Never reached high probability, but planning documents exist

jury_demonstration.slide_title: From Science to Action: Decision Framework
jury_demonstration.jury_impact: CHAMPIONSHIP FINALE: You're not just predicting disasters—you're enabling decisions that save lives
